snippet: Michel Djotodia, the Central African Republic’s president, quit under pressure after regional leaders held him responsible for failing to halt continuing sectarian violence in the country.
abstract: Joyful crowds pour onto streets of capital Bangui after Central African Republic's Pres Michel Djotodia resigns under pressure from regional leaders who hold him responsible for failing to halt continuing sectarian violence in the country.
lead_paragraph: Michel Djotodia, the Central African Republic’s president, quit under pressure after regional leaders held him responsible for failing to halt continuing sectarian violence in the country.

headline.main: Central African Leader’s Exit Sets Off Rejoicing in the Streets
headline.print_headline: Central African Leader’s Exit Sets Off Rejoicing in the Streets
